net.sf.click.control
Class Table

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.click.control.Table
All Implemented Interfaces:
Control, Serializable
public class Table
extends Object
implements Control

Provides a HTML Table control: <table>.

The Table control provides a HTML <table> control with DisplayTag like functionality. The design of the Table control has been informed by the excellent DisplayTag library, with the aim of making this control easy to learn for DisplayTag users.

The Table control automatically deploys the table CSS style sheet (table.css) to the application directory /click. To import the style sheet simply reference the PageImports object. For example: 

 <html>
  <head>
   $imports
  </head>
  <body>
   $table
  </body>
 </html>
The table CSS style sheet is adapted from the DisplayTag screen.css style sheet and includes the styles:
  • isi
  • its
  • mars
  • report
  • simple
To use one of these CSS styles set the table "class" attribute. For examle: 
 public CustomersPage() {
     Table table = new Table("table");
     table.setAttribute("class", "simple");
     ..
 }
See also W3C HTML reference Tables and the W3C CSS reference Tables.

Author:
Malcolm Edgar
See Also:
Column, Decorator, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Table

public Table(String name)
Create an Table for the given name.

Parameters:
name - the table name
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null

Table

public Table()
Create a Table with no name defined, please note the control's name must be defined before it is valid.

No-args constructors are provided for Java Bean tools support and are not intended for general use. If you create a control instance using a no-args constructor you must define its name before adding it to its parent.

Method Detail

getAttribute

public String getAttribute(String name)
Return the Table HTML attribute with the given name, or null if the attribute does not exist.

Parameters:
name - the name of table HTML attribute
Returns:
the Table HTML attribute

setAttribute

public void setAttribute(String name,
                         String value)
Set the Table with the given HTML attribute name and value. These attributes will be rendered as HTML attributes, for example: 
 Table table = new Table("customer");
 table.setAttribute("class", "simple");
HTML output: 
 <table id='customer-table' class='simple'>
   ..
 </table>
If there is an existing named attribute in the Table it will be replaced with the new value. If the given attribute value is null, any existing attribute will be removed.

Parameters:
name - the name of the table HTML attribute
value - the value of the table HTML attribute
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if attribute name is null

setListener

public void setListener(Object listener,
                        String method)
Description copied from interface: Control
Set the controls event listener.

The method signature of the listener is:

  • must hava a valid Java method name
  • takes no arguments
  • returns a boolean value

An example event listener method would be: 

 public boolean onClick() {
     System.out.println("onClick called");
     return true;
 }

Specified by:
setListener in interface Control
Parameters:
listener - the listener object with the named method to invoke
method - the name of the method to invoke
See Also:
Control.setListener(Object, String)

getRowCount

public int getRowCount()
Return total number of rows in the query, if 0 rowCount is undefined. Row count is generally populated with a SELECT COUNT(*) FROM .. query and is used to determine the number of pages which can be displayed.

Returns:
the total number of rows in the quer]y, or 0 if undefined
